channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole at entrance to Greendales footpath, 9th January
item.description:
A massive pothole is growing near the entrance of Greendales footpath. It has been present at this location for at least two years. Cyclists frequently need to navigate around the top lip of the pothole. Children are regularly knocked off their scooters due to the size of the pothole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Burrow Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes blocking pavement Grenville place jn to Portman Mews south, 9th January
item.description:
Bikes blocking pavement at 7 Portman Mews south jn to Granville place need to clear out causing nuisance and hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Portman Mews South, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent Dog fouling not being cleared up, 9th January
item.description:
There is a dog that is fouling and the owner is persistently failing to clear up the poo. There is consistenly uncleared foul around this location due to this dog and the owners.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Petherton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noise due to construction, 9th January
item.description:
The noise here is constant. Made even worse by the construction there is beeping and road rage at all hours of the day - well through the night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Morning Lane, Hackney, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned bike, 9th January
item.description:
This bike has been chained to the lamppost on the grass verge near the traffic lights since before Christmas, ie over two weeks. Chain is rusty etc so looks like someone has just abandoned it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 134, Lennard Road, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Matson house building front lights are off , and its very dark every night, 9th January
item.description:
Matson house building ( se16 2es ) front door lights for all building are off since a week , its very dark inthe building in a night time , i fall down last night due to extream darkness , while i was walking towrds my flate , i nearly broke my leg , can some one plz fix these building lights ,before any major incident happens , i have small children , they get scared , when its too dark ,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Slippers Place, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black recycling bin abandoned, 9th January
item.description:
This council recycling bin (black) has been sitting under the tree on the pavement since before Christmas, doesn't seem to have been reclaimed by any local residents and is now full of litter from passers by.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennard Road, Penge, Greater London

item.title: Broken pavements, 9th January
item.description:
These broken pavements are directly outside my house 40 Rangefield Road and have been like this for 17 years . The roadside was tarmac this morning now making it higher than the pavement slabs creating a tripping hazard . I have a elderly husband whoâ€™s not so good on his feet

item.title: Long trench/pot hole, 9th January
item.description:
Where G-network cabling was laid the road has sunk and broken up, causing a long trench/pot hole. This has got considerably worse over winter, to the extent it looks like a sink hole emerging. Extremely dangerous for cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Stoke Newington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
